name: Golden Well (U Zlate Studne)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel purely on the views of other Tripadvisor members, as a surprise trip for my husband's 50th birthday. I wanted something a bit special and this hotel certainly didn't disappoint.
reviews.title: Stunning in every respect

likes.liked: — The staff, the rooms, the attention to detail, everything infact

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a deluxe room for the 'Romantic Package', which includes lots of extras, such as wine, flowers & fruit in the room, inclusive airport transfers and a meal in the restaurant. On arrival we were delighted to be upgraded to the Rudolf II Suite, which was absolutely beautiful. Like the whole hotel, it was spotlessly clean, and the furnishings were lovely. There were 2 flat screen TV's & DVD's, a laptop, coffee maker, iPod & an array of Molton Brown amenities (as well as the usual shampoo & shower gel, there was also bath salts, mouthwash, lip salve & eye cream).
reviews.title: What more can I add??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom has a large Jacuzzi bath which, contrary to other comments, is really easy to use. There is also a shower head which can be wall mounted, so you can have a stand-up shower.
reviews.title: A Gem in Prague!

likes.liked: — Location. Quiet, serene respite from tourist crowds.

reviews.text: The bedroom is large with a 6-foot wide bed, comfortable mattress & choice of pillows. There are 2 windows, one with a view over the steps to the castle and the other over the gardens below and the whole city. Part of the wall in both the bedroom & lounge has been cut away to reveal the original beams, which adds to the historical interest of the building.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were lovely - you choose from a menu of hot food, including bacon, eggs, sausage, pancakes, french bread, omelettes etc., then help yourself to the buffet whilst it's being cooked. There was plenty of choice, including cereals, fruit, pastries, toast, cheese & ham.
reviews.title: It really is that good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best Hotel we have ever stayed in and we have stayed in a few including the Ritz in London. Their attention to detail is second to none and their thoughtfulness astounded us. We would thoroughly recommend The Golden Well to anyone and Prague is a very beautiful place too.
reviews.title: Bets Hotel we have ever stayed in

reviews.text: If you have the good fortune to travel to Prague, I highly recommend the small, but perfect Golden Well Hotel. It is steps away from the Prague Castle gardens yet a short walk or tram ride away from Old Town, the Rudolfinium and other performing arts locations. The food was truly five-star and their balconies provide breath taking views of this very old, very wonderful city.
reviews.title: Truly a golden well

reviews.text: We stayed in deluxe room for 3 nights, and experienced nothing but the best service we could get. Everything from the car service that picked us up at the airport to the snacks and beverages in the concierge room, the breakfasts and dinner at the roof top restaurant and the maid who came to make up our beds for sleeping in the evening - the whole stay was amazing .The receptionist that booked tickets for us and printed them out in the reception when we wanted to go to the opera, which was very helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel and city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff in the reception and the restaurant spoke perfect English, which was very impressive.
reviews.title: Deserves all the rave reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from a weekend in Prague. We chose to stay at the hotel because of the many positive reviews we read on Trip Advisor. The hotel lived up to the reviews, and then some. Our room was lovely, well appointed and spotlessly clean. The bed was quite comfortable and the bathroom was a pleasure with a heated floor for chilly mornings. The location is quiet and charming with spectacular views of the city and close enough to walk to everything in Old Town. The terrace restaurant (with it's private entrance to the castle garden) was beautiful and served delicious cuisine. The breakfast included in the room rate was bountiful and the best we've enjoyed in a European hotel.
reviews.title: The Gem of Gems in Prague

likes.disliked: — Location not in City Center, but not a show stopper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small gem. Near the castle yet very quiet. Friendly and attentive staff. Lovely room (#15, a bit of a splurge) unless you must have a shower. (Only a jacuzzi and hand spray). Bountiful breakfast served in a room with a sweeping view of beautiful Prague. A serene choice for anyone intending to walk in this most walkable city. Nearby trams weren't needed for our 3 day stay.
reviews.title: a small gem

reviews.text: Don't be put off by the decor in 'Kampa Seafood' because the fish and service are excellent. Finish with the chocolate concoction (plenty for two).
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel

reviews.text: 'David' was disappointing. A delicious potato soup promised much better than overcooked duck and mediocre guinea hen.
reviews.title: Fantastic Small Hotel
Golden Well Hotel, Prague
reviews.text: Having stayed at The Golden Well this past week, I can't think of anything to fault this hotel on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was extremely comfortable and spacious, spotlessly clean, and complete with it's own jacuzzi-bathtub. My bed also happened to be one of the most comfortable beds I've slept on.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

likes.liked: — Utter Perfection - faultless in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an experience!!!!
reviews.title: A Discovery...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seem a little exaggerate. No! You have to live that experience with this hotel ''Gloden Well'' once in your life . Serious.
reviews.title: Just perfect...

likes.liked: — perfect location, romantic environment, great staff, great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All attention, little details, name it, they do it. I had a bad luck to be sick one day. They new and they take care of me in my room while my wife visit the town. There so great.
reviews.title: This place is exceptional (beware of similar named hotel!)

reviews.text: The reception with Anastasia and Hayman where too much.They care for the client. All the staff where so careful. Yes you have to live that experience and is not exagarate.
reviews.title: Truely Wonderful

reviews.text: Marie-josee and Pierre from Montreal, Canada
reviews.title: A true gem

description: Charming traditional retreat in 16th-century Emperor's residence, set beneath the walls of Prague Castle. Wander up the cobbled, traffic-free streets to The Golden Well (U Zlate Studne), clinging to the wall in the shadow of Prague Castle, and you will uncover one of the city's best kept secrets. This modest collection of little inter-locking houses was once home to Emperor Rudolf II, and later the astronomer Tycho de Brahe. Sensitive renovation - has created a cosy yet refined hotel. The result is a pleasing balance of mod cons - jacuzzis, internet access, satellite TV - and old style elegance.
